meanings.definition: A tendency to consider material possessions and physical comfort as more important than spiritual values.
meanings.sent1: Her constant focus on buying new things shows her strong materialisms.
meanings.sent2: Some people prioritize materialisms over emotional connections.
meanings.sent3: His extreme materialisms led him to buy a diamond-studded toaster.
meanings.sent4: In a world consumed by materialisms, true happiness can be elusive.
meanings.sent5: The allure of materialisms can blind us to the beauty of simple moments.

meanings.definition: The belief that only physical matter exists and that everything can be explained in terms of physical laws.
meanings.sent1: His strict materialisms made him skeptical of anything beyond the physical world.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often base their research on the principle of materialisms.
meanings.sent3: The idea of materialisms can make the supernatural seem less mysterious.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the depths of materialisms can reveal the complexity of our universe.
meanings.sent5: Materialisms as a philosophy can limit our understanding of the unknown.

meanings.definition: The doctrine that nothing exists except matter and its movements and modifications.
meanings.sent1: The philosopher's radical materialisms challenged traditional beliefs about existence.
meanings.sent2: Some argue that strict materialisms ignore the essence of consciousness.
meanings.sent3: A world based solely on materialisms would lack the magic of imagination.
meanings.sent4: Materialisms, like shadows, change shape when exposed to different perspectives.
meanings.sent5: In a realm governed by materialisms, the intangible becomes inconceivable.
